New Records: Sanju Samson scored the second quickest hundred by an Indian, only bettered by Rohit Sharma's 35-ball ton against Sri Lanka in 2017.
India record their highest T20 total and finished on 297 - the highest T20I score by a Full-Member side.
Key Match Events: Sanju Samson's 40-ball hundred and quickfire knocks from Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya powered India to a 133-run win against Bangladesh.
Ravi Bishnoi took 3 wickets for 17 runs in 4 overs.
Litton Das scored 42 runs off 25 balls with 8 fours and 1 six.
Mahmudullah scored 8 runs off 9 balls with 1 four.
Tanzid Hasan scored 15 runs off 12 balls with 3 fours.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 75 runs off 35 balls with 8 fours and 5 sixes.
Pre-Game Insights: Suryakumar Yadav: We would like to bat first, looks a good wicket. These are the things we want to do. Set a target and defend the total with dew around.

Najmul Hossain Shanto: I am happy to bowl first, toss doesn't matter. We have two changes. Tamim and Mahedi are in. We need to take responsibilities as batters. We need to improve, need to execute our plans.
Post-Match Reflections: Sanju Samson's hundred was a significant moment in the match.
India's bowlers performed well to restrict Bangladesh to 164 runs.
India completed a 3-0 series sweep against Bangladesh.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad.
The weather was initially cloudy but cleared up before the start of the match.
Sanju Samson was backed by India's assistant coach, Ryan ten Doeschate, to continue his aggressive batting style.
Others: Bangladesh's assistant coach, Nic Pothas, blamed the team's poor six-hitting record on genetics.
India's batting performance was significantly better than Bangladesh's in the series.
